intro: Poecilochroma guttata, commonly known as the spotted chromis, is a species of marine fish belonging to the family Pomacentridae. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow body with black spots and a blue dorsal fin. This fish is typically found in coral reef environments across the Indo-Pacific region. It has a streamlined body shape adapted for swift movement through turbulent waters. Poecilochroma guttata plays a role in the ecosystem as both a predator and prey species.
